The board shows the ancient Mediterranean area from Lebanon to the straits of Gibraltar. <br/>Each player receives a number of ships and cities. The map is divided into rectangles.<br/><br/>Four starting rectangles are chosen by drawing location tiles. These areas are allocated one of the four differently colored types of empire counters. Each turn, players can play tiles corresponding to locations on the map. It's mandatory that these are next to tiles that already have an empire cou...

In Die Sieben Weisen (which can translate as "The Seven Magi"), the players form shifting alliances to compete for Crystals, with the player who obtains the most crystals during the game being the winner.<br/><br/>Each turn, the 7 roles in the game will be ranked in a hierarchy. Each player then chooses a role. When competing for the crystals later, each player may only play cards for his or her role (suit) or wild cards. Before that, however, players negotiate to form teams, which can...

This game is based on the TV show Die Fraggles (Fraggle Rock). The game board consists of two parts. Transfer between the parts is only possible through a gate in the middle. Cards determine where the players have to go; they can choose between rolling one or two dice to get there. There are two spinners, too, which change paths. When two cards' destinations have been reached, a player has to get a radish from the other side of the board and return home first to win the game.<br/><br/>

A variation of the game "Pick Up Sticks". Wooden cylinders are loaded into a circular Plexiglas frame and then removed one at a time by the players. If no cylinders move other than the one the player is trying to remove, the player keeps the piece (which is worth points). If another piece moves, however, the player must return the piece to the top of the pile and play proceeds to the next person. First player to reach a predetermined score wins.<br/><br/>

Asia's floating markets are pulsating with life. Junks are packed tightly together, bursting with loads of exotic goods from every part of the world. Merchants and their trainees move from boat to boat across narrow wooden foot-bridges, buying for the big markets in the city. In order to make the best deals is it important to be at right Junk at the right time. Skillful coordination of your actions is vital, if you want to become one of Asia's most respected Trade dealers.<br/><br/>

Millions of years ago the first men fought with other creatures for survival. By their ability to adapt to new types of terrain, they were able to flourish and eventually dominate the Earth. In this evolutionary game, players control up to six types of creatures indigenous to different regions of the land: Eagles (mountains), Bears (forests), Crocodiles (water), Mammoths (plains), Men (savannah), and Snakes (desert).<br/><br/>Each player takes the role of one of these six creatures, and tries to...

This is a WWII historical simulation, where you take the role of either the Germans or the Allies on the western front, designed by a veteran designer and historian. The novel 'initiative' system means that you never know who is going to move a piece next.<br/><br/>With both historical, and free set ups the German and Allied players can either follow in Eisenhower and/or Hitler’s footsteps, or fight the battles using their own plans.<br/><br/>

Rally is a road race simulation game. With Rally players can simulate a single race or a series of races representing the World Rally Championship. The time of play varies from 20 minutes to 10 hours. The choice is yours !<br/><br/>

Each player is the leader of an expedition trying to discover more about Loch Ness while attempting to solve the famous mystery.<br/><br/>Players must deploy their search equipment in the most advantageous way to obtain sightings, photos, sonar contacts, video and biological evidence.<br/><br/>Nessie Hunt the 1986 edition by Searchglen<br/>Nessie the 1989 edition by Silver Bear Marketing.<br/><br/>

\91\From the Compass Games webpage\93\<br/><br/>Victory at Sea, Original 1992 Edition is a strategic level game developed from Jedko’s popular naval game, War at Sea. This two-player game refights the Battle of the Atlantic in every detail. This is a game of Grand Strategy with each player assuming the role of an Admiral of the Fleet and trying to control the sea areas that are important to his nation’s interests. The rules are easy to learn, and yet require cunning strategies to ach...

Can you save London from the scourge of Jack the Ripper?<br/><br/>This game simulates the reign of terror over Victorian London, perpetrated by Jack the Ripper'. One player takes the role of Sir Charles Warren, the Police commissioner, and the other is the Ripper himself.<br/><br/>The Police player has 10 weeks to unmask the Ripper before he must resign in disgrace.<br/><br/>

In Clash of the Gladiators players form teams of Gladiators: Swordsmen, Spearmen, Net-throwers, Shield-Carriers, and Trident-Carriers. Each type of card has different effects on the combat die-rolls. Players gets points for kills. Wild Animals are thrown in to keep things interesting. Keep playing until only one player is left standing.<br/><br/>

The country of La Guerre des Moutons (the war of sheep) is full of fields and forests. There are sheep in the fields and wolves and hunters in the forests. Each player tries to make the largest pens with his own sheep inside by placing his own tiles. You can easily close small pens, or you can be ambitious and try to build large farms... but if you cannot enclose the fields, your sheep are likely to be eaten by the big bad wolves roaming in the nearby forests. Each player's animal is secret at the begi...

The only board game with all the slime and grime of the music business.<br/><br/>Form a band, recruit a manager, secure a record contract, then gig around the country in an attempt to get to Number One. You know, the old fashioned way .....before P*p Id*l.<br/><br/>

Cerberus covers combat over the entire surface of a planet. A unique system is used to depict the curved surface of that planet.<br/><br/>The playing pieces represent Bases, Spaceports, Mobile battalions and Special Forces platoons.<br/><br/>This is Task Force Game #3, one of Task Force Games's pocket games.<br/><br/>
Ares Magazine #11. Albion: Land of Faerie presents a fantasy war of Trolls versus Faeries and Humans in the Enchanted Isles (Britain and Ireland).<br/><br/>

Originally published in Dragon Magazine, issue #64.<br/><br/>From the Introduction: It is the far distant future. The planets around the sun have been tamed and colonized by humans. Unfortunately, the interplanetary government has grown corrupt and feeble. Power groups are marshaling their forces in efforts to gain control of the worlds, and the warships with which to hold them. Players are the leaders of these factions... all seeking to bring the most planets under their control. It will be a d...

Ares Magazine #5 Players form a party of Heroic Fantasy adventurers to journey into the Citadel of the evil mage "X the Unknown", gaining experience and power by fighting his monsters, and ultimately facing and defeating X himself.<br/><br/>The Citadel map is randomly generated during the game by drawing and placing rooms and corridors printed on 1/2" die-cut counters.<br/><br/>

Ares Magazine #7.   Rescue from the Hive simulates a Space Marine task force attempting to rescue a Human ambassador and family. Action takes place aboard a space ship, using forces selected by each player from a larger pool.<br/><br/>

Chafing at his minor role in the Snit games, the god Runngus once again leaves Bulbous and his other companions and sets about creating his own game on his own world.<br/><br/>The game mainly consists of dropping counters from a three foot height, and hoping they land in auspicious areas of the map.<br/><br/>Published in Dragon magazine, Issue #40.<br/><br/>

Political and military wargame set in a fantasy world. The players assume the roles of provincial kings set on conquest and consolidation.<br/><br/>Two original editions of this appeared, one in Ares Magazine #3 and one in an SPI boxed edition.<br/><br/>A revised edition was published 2001 by Jolly Roger Games.<br/><br/>from the Basic Description section of the rulebook:<br/>"Barbarian Kings is a simulation of the Red Age of political and military turmoil ...
This light, racing game is probably the least known of all the Dirk Henn creations. Predict in secret who will win. Title literally means "dead end relationships."<br/><br/>

Perpetual Notion is a clever and creative word association game where players take turns adding one-word descriptors to build a unique (and often hilarious) mental image of a mysterious object, creature, or concept. But here’s the twist: no one reveals what they’re thinking of until they’re challenged!<br/><br/>If someone calls your bluff, you must declare your imagin...

Jasper Carrott is a popular Brummy comedian who has fronted TV shows using funny TV ads. His photos front this lame game in which players write "funny" captions to "whacky" photos from the vaults of some photo agency library. Guess who wrote which caption and score points. 200 photos and a huge waste. Oh look, a dog on a lawnmower. Call an ambulance, my sides have split with "much hilarity".<br/><br/>

Accept and present demanding personal challenges, moral obligations and financial considerations.<br/><br/>Players attempt to build a viable, ' friendly ' financial empire within the constraints of a constantly changing inflation mechanism whilst resisting player takeover bids and personal challenges.<br/><br/>Unlike Monopoly, Cash Flow allows for all players to         ' be in the game ' at all times, even when they are without assets or cash.<br/><br/&g...

A Jenga/Mikado variant, de-construct a wooden pyramid without it falling and you losing, reconstruct a triangular structure and win. A surprisingly large wooden pyramid is made of 30 wooden pieces resting on a very solid wooden board, making the box really, really heavy.<br/><br/>

Question - Who did Neely Capshaw file false sexual harassment charges against? Situation - A cafe on the beach names a delicious health shake after you. It becomes a best seller. Roll & move round the beach, collecting discs, doing Physical Challenges (press-ups, star jumps), answering quiz questions or gamble on the situation, and then move on. Get three discs mat...

Aliens Attack!Will you be strong enough to prevent their attack or will they consume the entire galaxy?<br/>This game is a re-themed version of Pente with a small twist.<br/><br/>It consists of 80 counters (40 red and 40 silver) and an 8X8 battle grid that represent space.<br/>Each player takes 40 counters.<br/>One player represents the Aliens that are attacking the galaxy and the other is the defending force.<br/>There are several starting positions that players can choo...

Hoodwinked is a children's game with a mix of puzzles and challenges that the player must complete while the world is upside-down. You wear a pair of goggles with a mirror pointing down at 45 degrees, so your view of the world is inverted. The game has a deck of cards showing tasks, such as word puzzles, drawing puzzles and building with little wooden blocks. The quarter-board shows a crazy room and you progress from task to task until you reach to the finish.<br/><br/>

This is a seven card expansion for Beutelschneider.<br/><br/>It adds cards that can be played in a trick instead of cards dealt to affect the current trick.  The cards are used only once and then discarded.<br/><br/>

After the Little League game the players participate in a brawl.  You control cards representing the different kids who have different skills who then fight it out with hands and weapons.  Last player standing wins.<br/><br/>

Each card represents a Powerpuff girl and has a value on it.  From your cards you play a specific girls card in an attempt to steal the girl from another player.  They can then play cards to stop you.  Once you do obtain a girl you can then play cards from any girl you own to defeat a villain (of the 3 showing) for points.  You can not attack a villain with girls you controlled at the start of your turn unless you obtain a girl during your turn.  This forces you to deplete your hand before going after point...

On August 3rd, 1943, less than two weeks after the Kursk offensive, the Soviets launched a massive offensive near Kharkov that ripped open the German line. The ensuing battle began their summer offensive that would take them across the Ukraine to the Dnieper River.<br/>During August the two sides were equally matched and a tremendous war of attrition raged from Kharkov to the Sea of Azov with neither side willing to give ground. From the publisher's website:<br/><br/>Your worst nightmares have come true. We've taken your life, packaged it, and are selling it back to you... as a board game! That's right, it's just that easy. "NUTS! The Battle of the Bulge" is a card wargame for 2-4 players recreating the famous World War II battle in which the German Army mounted a surprise attack on the thin U.S. forces deployed in the Ardennes region, hoping to break through to the English Channel and split the Allied Forces.  Each player controls either the German or the U.S. and British forces.  Players draw cards in each daily turn from their own decks, then play the cards as they see fit.  Many cards can be played during the opp...

A lifeless alien lies upon the examination table, as players race to complete successful autopsies. An unsteady hand results in a reawakening scream and flashing eyes! The player who collects the most alien body parts wins! Requires two AA batteries, not included.<br/><br/>Re-implements:<br/><br/>    Operation<br/><br/><br/>

Players are kings (or queens) bidding for the services of six famous explorers -- Ferdinand Magellan, Christopher Columbus, Francisco Pizarro, Vasco da Gama, James Cook, and Marco Polo. As the game progresses, competition for the explorers' services increases as each explorer has fewer expeditions available for investment. In the end, only one ship for each explorer makes the final trip and only one king earns those rewards.<br/><br/>Firstly, the board is set up from two double-sided boards...

Very simple luck driven game.  Each player has 6 dice all showing the 6.  You hide your 'king' under one of the dice.  Then you roll two other dice and rotate an enemy die down the number of pips or rotate one of your dice up the number of pips.  You are trying to get a die down to nothing so you can look under it to see if you have captured a king.<br/><br/>

Card game version of Clue in which players must deduce who killed Mr. Boddy, what vehicle they used to escape, and to what destination they are headed.<br/><br/>Though this is very similar in name to Cluedo Card Game, the games do not appear to be related except for by theme; also not the same as a third Clue-themed card game, Clue: Card Game.<br/><br/>

In Lamarckian Poker players start with a hand resembling primordial ooze, but attempt through successive generations to "evolve" it into something more useful. But unlike Lamarck's giraffes, they may find themselves competing with others for the very same improvements. In the end, the player who has accumulated the best Poker hand wins.<br/><br/>Can be played using a standard Poker deck without Jokers.<br/><br/>Players start with four cards. Pocket Box; cover art by Dave Martin. 21" x 32" green/brown map, four sheets of black/red/white two-sided counters, rulebook. Related to the Game: Ogre / G.E.V..<br/><br/>Originally published as a magazine game in The Space Gamer (Issue 59 - Jan 1983) with misregistered counters. In this game, players compete to build the largest wall in Ancient China. Choosing from a hand of possible structures, players take turns adding sections to their walls, forming vast, snaking barriers to surround territory and gain military might. A cunning sense of strategy and a small bit of luck combine to decide the next emperor of China.<br/><br/>

Cat Attack, suitable for two to six players, aged 8 years and over and made entirely in the EU. The game has been designed with the fun strategy player in mind. Playing time 40 - 180+ mins depending on the number of players.<br/><br/>The game Cat Attack is based on the trials and tribulations of the domestic cat. The board represents a local neighborhood. Each player is a (model) cat that lives in its own house. To win the game a cat must fill its larder with six items of food. There is milk at ...

Imperator (161-217 AD) is a wargame for 2 players which covers all the campaigns of Rome against its ennemies, at a strategic level, from Marcus-Aurelius to Caracalla. Civil wars are also part of the game.<br/><br/>One player takes Rome proper while the other controls all the assorted barbarians plus usurpers which can be generated via Stratagem chit. The area-movement map features Scotland to Arabia. Combat is resolved via the Combat Results Table.<br/><br/>
Classic action game in which players spin a top onto the playing field and score points based on which pins the top knocks over.<br/><br/>

This is a representative of this peculiarly American class of board game produced for political reasons, as a form of parody. As the player tokens go around the board, th...

This game was published for political reasons, to "make" a point. That it turns out to be somewhat enjoyable is purely coincidental.<br/><br/>In this game, a player may win by maneuvering all four of their "criminals" in such a way that they are all in Life Imprisonment, Death Row, or the Electric Chair. Or the player may use their two "liberals" to spring the opposing players’ criminals from the "Path of Justice" back to the Street often enough to t...

Collectible Card Game in which players are "Magi" using their powers to summon creatures to battle for them.  Similar to Magic: The Gathering in many ways, except there are no "lands" or similar methods of generating magical power.  Instead, players siphon power from their Magi or their monsters to perform attacks or put cards into play, thus controlling just how many powerful cards a player can attempt to unleash in a single turn. (in essence, you must sacrifice your own creatures to fu...
Generation of an ideal girl.<br/><br/>
Based on the novel by Jonathan Swift.<br/><br/>

This expansion to Kardinal & König allows the game to be played by two players.  It adds a third, neutral, player (the King) which players alternate playing pieces of onto the board.  Five new influence cards indicate for which player the King's pieces score.  Additionally, each player has three special action cards which allow them to break certain rules when surrendered.<br/><br/>Expands:<br/><br/>    Kardinal & König/Web of Power<br/><br/><br/>

This cut-out-the-cards expansion to the normally two-player game Kontor provides two additional player decks for a third and fourth player.  It includes additional rules for three- and four-player games.<br/><br/>Expands<br/><br/>    Kontor<br/><br/><br/>

Individual battles between famous Star Wars characters set on different board locations. Players choose a major character that is accompanied by one or two minor characters. Each set of characters has its own deck of cards which are used for attack, defense, or special abilities. Each deck is unique with certain special powers relevant to the major character. There are different modes of play; one-on-one battles, up to three teams can play against each other, or up to six players can play a free-for-all bat...

Two to Five players take on the roll of the Jedi in a battle against creatures and droids on the Geonosis battle field.  Players receive a number of Jedi cards from a random draw.  The Jedi are distributed around the circular battle field as are the enemy.  Players then move one of their Jedi and attack the enemy, followed by moving one of the enemy and attacking an opposing player's Jedi.  The advanced game includes the Reek which players may try to climb upon and/or crush their opponents with. There ...

FROM THE INTRO: 2028, a fateful year for the human race, the Third World War began about 30 years previously.  By now the world is for all practical purposes destroyed as the nuclear catastrophe descended with undreamed of disastrous effects on the human race.  The face of the earth is changed and numerous areas around the globe are contaminated and destroyed.  Now mankind must fight against aliens, mutants, delinquents, looters, criminals, disease, radiation, and all the other ills the war has brought.  Th...

Vier aug einen streich combines elements from the card game Memory  and the chip game Connect Four.<br/><br/>The game consists of a deck of 16 cards with various simple images, 16 chips with corresponding images, a bag and a rule sheet.<br/><br/>The cards are placed face-down on a table in a 4x4 grid and the chips are placed in the bag. Players take turns drawing chips out of the bag and attempt to turn over the card with the same image as indicated on the chip. If the image on the c...
Delightfully graphic design has the Greeks sailing home from victory at Troy, but all around the islands on the hexagonal grid.<br/><br/>
In digging the BlueMilk Canal, problems arise. An grown-up mix of tiles, voting, wordplay and satire, impenetrable to non-German speakers.<br/><br/>
Re-issue of Adlung's Maskenball, this time themed on a Venetian costume ball. Very nice cards. Rules in German, English &  French.<br/><br/>

12 priests follow 12 gods in ancient Egypt. Players distribute support between the gods and then the priests are moved and conflict and a power struggle to reach the pinnacle of a pyramid. The game involves magnetic stickers being placed on the god and priest counters, so that a priest connects to its particular god in secret initially. One of the gods is hidden at the top of the pyramid. When it is revealed, the player who has the most supporters in that god's temple will win. Nice graphics.<br/&gt...
Cards & dice create a game themed on cocktail drinking. The rules include a recipe for a Bloody Mary. Published in an L-shaped box.<br/><br/>

Trick taking card game. Knights progress around King Arthur's Round Table.<br/><br/>Re-implements Trumpet. This version adds another kind of super-trump, and there are no board spaces for moving opponents backward.<br/><br/>
Card game with a numbered, colored deck and another 'Murphy' deck with rules switches. Too much German text to be useful to non-gamers. Published by Ravensburger under their FX label.<br/><br/>

Monks must climb Athos Mountain to reach the monastery, moving over difficult terrain. You may move your monks or draw and place tiles, which block paths with landslides. You also have 2 Athos pieces, which allow you to move a tile and lock another. Reaching the monastery gives you additional moves.<br/><br/>

In Plan-Cheroli each player has three arches which start at one corner of the board and must be moved to the opposite corner. On each turn, one arch is moved by rotating one leg of the arch around the other leg, with other pieces blocking the rotation.<br/><br/>Several variants are included. There are chips which can be placed on the board at the start of the game to block certain spaces, creating different board configurations. Alternatively, all the spaces can be covered with chips, and the go...
Themed on pre-historic cave paintings, this appears to be a set building game. Rules in German, English, French & Italian.<br/><br/>

This game is intended for children Ages 4 and up.  In turn, each player rolls the die and pulls their bear to the ring on the board of the corresponding color.  The player hopes to pull other player's honey drops and playing pieces (bear) into the hole in the middle of the board.  Pulling another bear into the hole scores the player whose turn it was honey drops.  This is a simple roll and move game.  Not much here for adults, but kids will enjoy playing it.<br/><br/>
In Doubt For The Accused is a card game of guilt or innocence but has total German text on the cards.<br/><br/>

Moon & Sun Druids select a new leader by moving around the circles of stones. A mix of cards and dice and symbols.<br/><br/>The Druids start from the Grove, in the centre of the Stone Circle. When a player begins his turn, he must move his druid, firstly, onto one of the 6 stones showing a Pentagram. This is the only space that may be moved to, from the centre area. The player throws both dice. At the beginning of the game each player has only one piece available (his Druid), therefore only ...
Think!? A tri-fold board with a long track has players rolling dice to move and stack pieces to the finish.<br/><br/>

A card-driven placement game. Four priests attract support to their temple from the Sun & Moon. Each player is trying to maximize the value of 2 of the priests, revealing them at the end. Whichever has the highest combined score will win.<br/><br/>

Unowned clipper ships race back to Europe with valuable exotic goods. Players have secret interests in various ships and play cards to move them.<br/><br/>Not to be confused with Dan Glimne's Ostindiska kompaniet.<br/><br/>
In The Limelight, a card driven game in which different actors try to take center stage under the warm glow of the spotlights. The cards show the performers under 1,2 or 3 spotlights.<br/><br/>

The goal is to capture enemy ants to get parts of the ant queen that are pictured on the bottom of the pieces. All ants are magnetic and if the piece that you try to capture repels from your piece that piece captures you instead.<br/><br/>Move your 14 ants around on the dice roll, come back to your base and flip the pieces you have caught on your way. The base of your ants shows a part of the queen. Whoever gets the most parts of the queen's set, wins.<br/><br/>

Hack Attack is played with 12 plastic pieces in green, orange and purple. 6 of these pieces are cubes and 6 are pyramids. There are 12 board strips with green, orange and purple squares. The object of the game is to get one of each color (green, orange and purple) of your game pieces (one player is cubes and one player is pyramids) in a row (vertically or horizontally) on the matching colors of the board strips. The board strips are shuffled and dealt out 6 to each player. The first player lays one of their...

Historically, Albrecht von Wallenstein, duke of Friedland and Mecklenburg, was one of the most important mercenary commanders of the Imperial army during the Thirty Years' War (1618-48). His overweening ambition was to head a large central European empire, which got him dismissed in 1630. Such was his power, however, that the empire was forced to reinstate him when Sweden came into the fray. He recovered Bohemia, but was defeated by Gustavus Adolphus at Lützen, and was again dismissed. His subsequ...

Two player tactical level game simulating helicopter combat from 1975 through 1990. Units represent individual vehicles, helicopters and infantry squads. Each game turn represents 2 minutes and each hex represents 100 meters of actual terrain. Two maps included: One represents Middle Eastern terrain, and the other German. Forces represented include the United States, West Germany, Great Britain, Israel, the Soviet Union and Syria.<br/><br/>
A tricky game with colour, players use 30 round and 30 oval pieces, placed on a board showing faces/masks in a theatrical Japanese style.<br/><br/>

A Trival Pursuit style game with the object to increase your knowledge of the planetary system and obtain as many earth symbols as possible. If instructed to read a Planet card or a Sun card, the person on the right has first chance to answer, continuing around the board to the right (counter-clockwise). The first person with the correct answer receives the earth symbol. Recommended ages 10...

1776 is a two-player, turn-based war game played on a hex grid map of the thirteen colonies and Canada.  It is primarily concerned with the military aspects of the American Revolutionary War. Traverse is played on a square "checker" game board with a 12 1/2" x 12 1/2" grid. Each player chooses one color of playing pieces. Sack of Lies, a card game for liars, the box cover shows a wolf, fox, vulture and cobra competing for the pot! You must clear your hand of 10 cards, by placing successive cards face down on the deck, bluffing as necessary. So the deck is started by a player laying 1s, the next player lays 2s, one by one and so on. At some point, your bluff is called. If you were false, draw more cards. If you were true, your opponent draws. There are action cards, including a sack of lies which has no value and so you must ...

A card driven placement game for Lighthouse Architects. Discs in black, white and red are moved to construct stacks matching the color bars off the lighthouses on the cards.<br/><br/>3rd Place 1993 Hippodice Spieleautorenwettbewerb.<br/><br/>

Four battles featuring Frederick the Great in the Seven Years War: Rossbach, Leuthen, Zorndorf and Torgau. Hearts variant where each of the Queens play a role in the final scoring: the Queen of Hearts doubles the points for hearts collected; the Queen of Spades counts 26; the Queen of Clubs negates the Queen of Spades; the Queen of Diamonds counts -10.<br/><br/>

Two Scottish players participate in a classic tug-of-war, joined on occasion by Nessie.  Players first scramble to build their decks in real time.  After the decks have been built, card play goes back and forth until someone pulls the whisky barrel across their line and claims it. First one to win three whisky barrels wins the game.<br/><br/>Heave Ho! is part of the Kosmos two-player series.<br/><br/>

Pieces move by sliding orthogonally or diagonally until blocked by the edge of the board (5x5) or another piece.<br/>The object of the game is to arrange your pieces in a line of three either orthogonally or diagonally.<br/><br/>

Jedi Knight or Sith Lord? Awesome warrior or mystical thinker? These are the choices players face in GAME OF LIFE: A JEDI'S PATH. Along the way, players can choose the Jedi path or the riskier/quicker "Dark Path." But be careful, once you go down ...

Players build a pyramid using 40 numbered cards, taking care to construct the pyramid with the lowest value card at the bottom left, and the highest at the top. This is done by each player, in turn, offering two cards from their hand. The opposing player takes one of the two for his/her pyramid, leaving the other for the first player to put on their pyramid. Cards already on a pyramid can be covered once (after that they are covered by a jaguar stone), an action that triggers movement along the jungle path ...

Soccerboss is a game of chance and skill. Fire Zone thrusts Frag players into two deadly new arenas, where massive pools of boiling lava are as dangerous as the other players. This expansion also features new rules like rocket jumps, knock back effects from weapons, and jump pads.<br/><br/>

This is a steam engine race for up eight players. The board has a spiral shaped track leading to the middle, then back to the edge. Each player receives an engine. Much praised cycle racing sim from innovative Czech game company. The wrapper unfolds to be the game board showing a street race course. The game has advertising from cycle shops. Rules in Czech and German.<br/><br/>

Double Down, first released as Lobo 77, is a simple game of playing cards to add to (or subtract from) a running total. Players must try to avoid creating a total which is a multiple of 11, or taking the total over 77. Chips, given out at the start of the game, are lost as players fail to keep to these rules. The hardboiled detective in the Thirties. Players work as operatives for the Continental Detective Agency entering the exciting, exotic and dangerous underworld of 1934 San Francisco. Players gradually complete the layout of the front page of the local newspaper Nurnberger Nachrichten. Re-issue of Ausbrecher AG, with children dawdling to be the last into class and get to sit at the back. Includes selection cards showing the randomized positions, instead of the original version's choices being written out by the players. A light and funny dice-roller worth getting.<br/><br/>

The Game simulates the legendary world of Edgar Rice Burroughs, Barsoom. Very large plastic board has alternating studs in red and white. Players place their colored tile with a line between the matching studs to form lines and boxes.<br/><br/>

An abstract path laying game in which players try to block each other's moves whilst making chains. This game is based upon C. J. Cherryh's Hugo winning Downbelow Station novel.<br/><br/>It uses area like movement between jump points for starships to move around a map of explored space. Bring your pawns together in the maze. The rules include a brief history of mazes and a list of British mazes open to the public.<br/><br/>

Themed on Chaucer's Canterbury Tales and an old dice game called Hasard, players gamble stakes on dice rolls, allowing to progress along the track. In doing so, they lay cards depicting the various pilgrims progressing to Canterbury.<br/><br/>

Players move from inn to inn, collecting characters to complete the 6 chapters of a Dickens novel. The first player that has a "complete novel" wins the game. Russell Grant was a popular, jolly, rotund, camp TV astrologist in the 80s in the UK and this game contains advertising for his horoscopes, his premium rate phone lines and his personal charts by computer. Each player has a sheet showing words written in Egyptian hieroglyphs. Players roll a die and move around a board showing the glyphs, and put a counter on their sheet as their glyphs are reached. A version of Ludus Duodecim Scriptorum, the Roman precursor to Backgammon. Players move their stones round the 24 place track, knocking each other off as they go. A nice edition, with a board styled as a Roman mosaic, glass beads as pieces and the dice have Roman numerals.<br/><br/>

Collectible card game based on the Harry Potter novels written by J.K. This is a simulation of a soccer tournament. Players manage their teams and play each other by rolling dice. The more balls players roll with the special dice. The more balls they throw with the special dice the more goals they potentially can score.<br/><br/>
Yet another imitation of Formula Dé. Roll the dice, try to get the correct symbols and run!<br/><br/>

The game consists of a board, showing 30 different types of contraband goods, Gold, Cigarettes etc, each marked by a small picture and it's name. Each picture has a matching tile, which is placed face down over it. Players each receive a number of chips and then take two or three (depending on the number of players), of the tiles for themselves, announcing which they have taken and then laying them face down in front of them. Now play begins.<br/><br/>The players take turns to roll the die ...

The players represent wizards and visit the many cities of the board delivering messages. While gathering gems in the process, they are also challenged with wild magic creatures to battle with. The wizard who ascends the magic ladder higher wins.<br/><br/>

Star of the Guardians is a 2-player Collectible Card Game in which the players play cards to deploy spaceships and destroy each other's empire. Super Deck! is a card game, in which players select a heroic and a villainous champion, and send the two to fight against their opponent's respective villain and hero.<br/><br/>Players first built up their deck (a minimum of 40 cards) and begin play with a 7-card hand.  They place their selected hero on their left to begin their Hero stack and start their Villain stack on their right. Super Pippo (Italian name for Super Goof) is one of those children's games you love when you're an adult too (much like Looping Louie). The board has a big plastic peanut in the middle, filled with holes with numbers in them. The players move around the board collecting peanuts of several colors; once a player has a particular combination, he may "launch" a Super Goof miniature, using a spring-driven plastic skyscraper, trying to make it land in the holes with high numbers. "D3 Time Warriors" is a universal rules set for miniature wargaming at a skirmish level. The first publication of the game, in the italian gaming magazine "KAOS", included cardboard counters and army lists for playing the game in a science fiction setting, later used also in the "Sandsplatters" game (based on the same rule set) and in the "Nemesis" starship combat game.<br/><br/>

A children's memory game. A hand of colorful cards depicting birds, worms, etc are dealt to every player, and around 20 cards that match the cards in the player's hands are scattered face down around the table. Players must match cards from their hand with cards on the table to clear out their hand. First to do this wins.<br/><br/>This game is part of The Chicken Family of Zoch.<br/><br/>

Reggi un Attimo! ("Hold it!" in the Pressman american version) is a party-game where players must hold common objects such as umbrellas, pens, chairs, keys or whatever it is decided in the deck of personalizable cards - the players may choose the objects they have at home in that moment. The deck supplied has some suggestions: televisions, glasses, fishbowls (!) and bottles. The board is constructed with cards as well: landing on a space may force you to hold another object or to pass or exchange ...

This game's name is a play off the fact that the designer, Alfred M. Butts, is also the designer of Scrabble.   Up to four players conduct a solitaire-like contest simultaneously, trying to achieve maximum scores.  Words of all one color double your points, certain letters have premium values, and if you use all the letters in one play you get a bonus.  Has both a basic and a more challenging “duplicate” mode of play.<br/><br/>

Players divide into two teams: men vs. women.  The goal is to move your team's pawns across the game board.  Along the way teams will have to answer questions about the opposite sex in order to move.  For example, "How many lugs are on the typical wheel?" or "Where is the Superdome located?" are questions that would be given to the female team.  "How do you stop a run in stockings?" or "What type of nut is used to make marzipan?" would be given to the males.  The...

Players work together to complete four Christmas scenes before the manger scene in the middle of the board is covered.  Players roll the die and move their piece around the board.  They can land on “good” spaces (e.g., “gift giving”, “do a good deed”, etc.) which allow them to draw one of the scene pieces, trade pieces with another player, etc.  They can also land on “bad” spaces (e.g., “people are mean to one another”, “robbers”, etc.)...

Another entry in the "VCR as game component" genre of games.  The object is to bribe, ransom and scheme your way to riches.  Players bid against each other for the treasures that appear behind colorful doors.  But also have to deal with hidden dangers and penalties.  Classic film clips and graphics add a dimension of sight and sound to the game.<br/><br/>

An electronically enhanced version of Stratego from back before personal computers were commonplace.  Game play is the same as the classic board game except for a few interesting twists:<br/><br/>· When you attack an opponent’s piece, the computer tells you whether you have won, lost, or tied.  So you do not know the exact strength of the opposing piece, only its strength relative to your own piece (and so too your opponent does not know the exact strength of the piece you used to a...

Trivia game that claims its questions are not "trivia" but "facts that are drawn from, or relevant to, everyday life".  Each card has one question for players Ages 10-15, and a different question for players Ages 16 and up.  In this way kids can compete on more equal footing with adults.<br/><br/>

A game inspired by the book by John Gray.  Each turn one player draws a card and must answer a multiple choice question.  The other players attempt to guess how that player will answer.  Points are awarded for guessing correctly.  The questions deal with provocative and sometimes sensitive topics (sexuality, values, etc.), so one of the choices that is available to the answerer is "choose not to answer" (called the "cave" for men and "well" for women).<br/><br/>

Option is a Scrabble-like game where players form words crossword-style to score points.  The twist is that instead of tiles the players use prisms that have letters on two sides in two different colors (bonus points are scored for making a word with all one color).  Players can also flip letters already on the board in order to make new words.<br/><br/>

Similar to Fireball Island, Tornado Rex is a 3D action game in which players try to be the first to get their two hikers to the top of the mountain. They draw a card to determine what kind of move they can make (forward, backward, switch places, etc.). The cards also determine when Tornado Rex is released. He's a spinning creature that careens down the mountain trail knocking off any hiker he happens to hit.<br/><br/>

Players take the role of a Napoleonic-era power and move miniature plastic infantry, cavalry and artillery to simulate the campaigns of Napoleon.  Several difficulty levels and scenarios included in the box.  Standard game has a map that offers a grand strategic view of the action, and separate board for battles to reflect tactical realities of the period such as combined arms, infantry square formations, and reserves.  Standard game also includes diplomacy, fleets, and economic system.<br/><br/&gt...

Millionary is a big business game about buying and selling shares and options.  The game uses real company names like Shell and Microsoft and real markets like the Dow Jones and the Dax.  The game rules offer both a family version that uses a roll-and-move mechanic, and a strategy version for real gamers that does not involve dice.  The rulebook is highly detailed with three complete sample games, but alas all in German.<br/><br/>
A soccer game simulation. It uses flat cardboard microscopic tokens and mechanics similar to GW's Blood Bowl.<br/><br/>

Players move around the game board earning stars (points) by correctly answering trivia questions about the USA in seven different categories:<br/>  · People, Places and Things<br/>  · Presidents of the United States<br/>  · States of the Union<br/>  · Inventors and Authors<br/>  · Government<br/>  · The United States at War<br/>  · Famous Americans<br/><br/>

This game consists of three dice and a set of poker chips.  Each player starts with three chips and on their turn a player rolls the three dice. Published in The Wargamer Magazine Vol.I, #23, this game covers the German operations called Fruelingswind & Morgenluft which led to the famous battle at Kasserine Pass in Tunisia in 1943. Players are given lines from well known movies or television shows and must act them out in order to get team-mates to guess the film.  The first team to get 35 points wins.<br/><br/>

The conflict between the Greeks and Trojans in the four days described in detail by Homer, including Achilles' departure. (From the rules card)<br/><br/>You are a collector of fabulous items.  You start with little money but have 9 precious un-cashed checks. From the rules:  "The Object:  Make your way into Drakus' castle, fighting the monsters as you go. Game was produced by Stars on Stripes Co, Incorporated , 406 McKenna Building, Pittsburgh, PA. On the box it says The GRANT Building.<br/><br/>A simple simulation of an football game. Arena of Death: Heroic Combat in the Fantasy World of DragonQuest, is a game of gladiatorial combat in a fantasy setting. 1-2-3 OY! is a set of ten card games which are adaptable to any age level or ability. Both fast and slower card games are included and the games are suitable for ages 5 to adult.  Directions in English, French and Spanish.<br/><br/>

The four great gnome tribes (forest, swamp, mountain and plains) are at war.  These gnomes are small, itching for a fight, very ingenious but terribly avaricious. Tic Tac Chec is both a chess teaching tool and a clever strategy game.  Each player has four pieces: a knight, a rook, a bishop and a pawn. Play starts on an empty 4 x 4 board and players take turns placing a piece on any open square.  Once at least three pieces are placed per player, they may move a piece, capture a piece or place their remaining piece.  Captured pieces are returned to their player a...

Noble Celts is a circular chess boardgame that is played exactly like regulation Chess.  There are 64 circles corresponding to the 64 squares.  Diagonal moves are made along lines that spiral into and out of the center of the board.  Pieces are set up along the outside of the circle and around the center ring, and play is inward or outward.  The lack of a side edge to what, if uncurled, would be a normal chess board makes for very exciting play.<br/><br/>

(from Tilsit's page: <a target='_blank' href="http://www.tilsit.fr/fiches_jeux/xiii.php" rel="nofollow noreferrer noopener">http://www.tilsit.fr/fiches_jeux/xiii.php</a>)<br/><br/>Vance and Van Hamme have created a very successful graphic novel series entitled "XIII" --it currently boasts 20 albums (along with 5 albums in it's spin-off series: XIII mystery). Simple, tile-based game for two players in which each person controls a row of tiles representing various groups of ants. This Mini or Pocket Pack was made for use with the Trivial Pursuit Pocket Player Set Game but also featured color coded questions for use with the regular Trivial Pursuit games. This set contains 120 questions about films and cinema.<br/><br/>

The Triangle awaits. You are a restless apprentice who has worked hard for the last ten years studying and practicing to become a Mage. A wild, no holds barred game of tenure politics. Knowledge is nothing. Tenure is everything!<br/><br/>It's the brutal world of higher education - the misery of sweltering in the rarefied air of that medieval ritual; surviving the politically correct minefield to achieve the ultimate in bourgeois living - Tenure. Released after Return of the Jedi, part of a series of games depicting Star Wars events, this game plays out the battle on Hoth. The object of Superpower is to control as much of the Third World as possible by the end of the game. A player chooses between one of four actions on his turn:  Moving his pawn on the board via die roll; military fortification of a previously influenced country; military response to another player's prior coup d'etat against a non-fortified country; ...

An operational level simulation representing commerce raiding in the Indian Ocean during WWII. A very light card game based on the machinations of a pro wrestling bout.  The two combatants gain and lose energy based on successful and unsuccessful attack cards played. Hex Nut is a simple geometric game in which two players take turns laying down hex nuts with strict placement rules, or moving whole chains which are linked together. The object of British Square is to place the greatest number of your pieces on the 5x5 board. On your turn you may place your piece anywhere on the board except orthogonally next to any of your opponents pieces. (Diagonally adjacent is acceptable) Play continues until both players are unable to place pieces. Winner is the player with the most pieces on the board.<br/><br/>

Subbuteo is a classic finger-flicking football-simulation action game. Meet Wacky Jackie, Bill Loney and Moe DeLawn along with 21 of their off-the-wall friends in this hilarious card game of match-making and memory. Collect three matching treats or else it's an all out food fight with everyone flinging their cards and scrambling to make matches! Got three of a kind? (From the Introduction)<br/><br/>Smokejumpers is a solitaire game simulating fire fighting efforts. The player assumes the role of a fire boss and must decide the most effective way of fighting a forest fire - both in terms of tactics used and value lost. Fire growth is governed by the game system with wind and fuel moisture content as the driving forces. The goal of the player is to contain the fire while keeping costs low and still be able to get home in time for supper.<br/><br/>

In Show Jumping, up to 4 players attempt to run their horse through a series of jumps, in the least amount of moves. Dice rolls are used to determine movement, but each player can maneuver their horse to the best possible point to attempt a jump. Jump cards can also be obtained and held, which can help a player go over a particularly hard jump. Players try to collect as many gems as possible using their 4 followers. This is done by selecting a die (1-3 or 4-6) and rolling and moving. Breakthrough was designed by William Daniel 'Dan' Troyka in 2000 and originally played on a 7x7 board. The diplomacy is intense, for when the Emperor dies, there will be a battle to the death.<br/><br/>

This hard-to-find German game with simple mechanics uses a very unusual board inspired by the drawings of M.C. Escher and hand painted (!) clay figurines. Two teams of either 1 or 2 players compete, the "vampires" try to hunt down the "brigands" who try to escape the castle Glebdo with a valuable codex. Although no dice are rolled for movement going anywhere at all is actually extremely hard on this board, as the hallways twist and turn in a nausea inducing manner...<br/><br/&gt...

Trick-taking card game for 3 or 4 players where votes are cast after the deal and for what conditions apply for that hand, such as which suit is trump (if any) or passing your entire hand to the right. Players cast their votes by placing some (or all) of their chips onto a specific rule card. Once you've used your allotment of chips, you can no longer vote in later hands. Players get 10 points for each trick won, unless modified by a rule that was voted for that hand. High score after 4 hands wins.<...

"Sturm Nach Osten" is a Strategic level two-player wargame that covers the World War 2 Eastern Front from June 1941 to May 1945 with one-month turns. The game has variable victory conditions reflecting the historical ebb and flow. Main units are fronts, armies and corps; also units for static Garrisons and Soviet factories (need to move Eastward by rail before capture); markers for fortification, artillery, overrun/blitz and dispersal are all provided. At least two each of men and women must play.  Questions are asked, "If you were a man/woman ..." with multiple choice.  You get points by matching the majority vote of those of the opposite gender.<br/><br/>

A game with an obvious political agenda (arms reduction) that succeeds anyway (at being an entertaining game).  Each team plays either the U.S. or the U.S.S.R. with a large nuclear weapons stockpile.  Most of the fun comes in the negotiations and voting.  Both sides win if they succeed in reducing the nuclear stockpile, Nuclear Escape.  One side can win by having less than 100 million in casualties, AND significantly more nuclear weapons than the other side and the rest of the world, Nuclear Domination.  Th...

Consists of only 24 cards with happy situations on one side (true love, buying a new home, vacationing, etc.) and the Black Cat ruining the situation on the other side (heartbreak, getting locked out, getting lost, etc.). The loser of the game is the one with the most catastrophes at the end (everyone else wins).<br/><br/>Re-implements: Who Is Going to Do the Dishes?<br/><br/>
Pachisi variant where the goal is to get at least one of each of the other color of tokens ("secrets") into your home embassy.  Secrets can be taken from other spies or foreign embassies.<br/><br/>

Each player selects a color (publically announced) and then the entire deck is shuffled and each player is dealt four cards from the deck (they may get cards of their own color, they may get cards of their opponent's colors).  On your turn, you draw a card from the pile and then place a card onto the board.  The card placed on the board must match the card/illustration of the card it is placed onto (cards feature illustrations of characters, creatures and objects from The Dark Crystal). This rendition of Snakes and Ladders has Richard Scarry characters and art and a stand-up board that actually allows the poles (and hoses) to slide the pawns back down to the earlier space.<br/><br/>

From the box:<br/>Ahoy matey! One of your fellow captains is about to send you on a treasure hunt. Unfortunately, all he is going to give you is a blank map. The object is to visit all of the shops on the board and purchase one of each item for your wizard's trunk.  The first player to fill their trunk and return to the Leaky Cauldron wins.<br/><br/>You have to pass by Gringott's Wizard Bank several times to get enough money (plastic galleons, sickles and knuts) to purchase everything. Hogwart's school supply list includes potion bottles, cauldrons, robes, wands, books and owls.  The shops don't have enough for everyone, so you mu...

Roundhouse is an interesting game from Winsome where players use a limited set of action points to move locomotives into repair stalls and get them repaired.  The name comes from the fact that a turntable (in concept)is used to take trains from three input points and move them to five different repair bays.  Players deploy workers at the bays, and when the locomotive is repaired and released everyone who contributed to the repair gets paid.<br/><br/>

Contiquences is the new board game that combines trivia with world power.  In your quest to control the world you must show that you have the knowledge to do so.  Move around the world take control of an area, but be careful your opponents may take control away from you.  Can you handle the Contiquences<br/><br/>

A path-race game based on the movie, TRON.  Various spaces and situations in the game pit players against one another, Sark, or the Master Control Program by the players' pawns firing "light discs".<br/><br/>
In this otherwise typical children's path-race game, instead of sending your opponents' play-dough pawns back to start, you smash them.<br/><br/>

Won Over is a trick-taking card game with a race-to-the-finish twist. Players compete to advance pawns along a 12-space track toward a Finish card, with each trick won moving their token forward—unless another player is already in the way, in which case you leap ahead to the next open spot!<br/><br/>Trump suits shift with the lead pawn's position, and special cards add strategy and surprise:<br/><br/>Suit Yourself cards act as ultimate trumps, overriding the current suit.&...

Having mentioned your name in his Roman epic, the renowned poet, Flabbius Corpus, invites you to a banquet for the premier recitation of his historical work. When you arrive, you discover there's been a murder in the garden and a priceless statue is missing. You assume the role of one of these great Roman characters and solve the mystery. Like a history lesson come to life, the schemes of less-than-noble characters are laid bare.<br/><br/>CHARACTERS<br/>Licentius Caesar, Rotunda Immac...

A path-race game based on the movie, The Dark Crystal.  This game uses a physical manifestation of time, so not only are the players racing against one another, they are also racing against "time" to attempt to restore the crystal.<br/><br/>

Based on the movie of the same title, players move around a world map collecting cards and try to obtain the Ark, Staff of Ra, and the Map Room.<br/><br/>Players can move by rolling the die and trying to pass through a country space to get a card.  Some paths have checkpoints which require a Passport to avoid losing a turn. A Yahtzee variant from the people who made Yahtzee.  Players drop the dice down the dice chute (dice tower) instead of rolling them by hand.  The object is to form the same poker-like number sets as Yahtzee, only the scoring is a bit different.  There are no scoring sheets; no pencils are needed.  Instead, built-in score cards are used which indicate the point values for each successfully rolled "hand". In this game, similar in some ways to Mille Bornes, players attempt to play corridor cards to progress down into a dungeon. By reaching the 100 distance mark and returning, treasures and prizes are collected, which can give victory points and also aid in exploring further dungeons. 8 track cards (from a total of 48 cards) are used to build a track.<br/>Each player gets 5 tempo cards.<br/>All players play tempo cards simultaneously and try to get in front of the field.<br/>6 cars are NON-player cars - these are called "Alte Hasen" (old pros) and are controlled by a rule mechanism - the same rules are used when playing this race alone - there are always seven cars in the race (one old pro for example when 6 players are playing)<br/>The chips are earned ...

Two letter tiles appear when one player slides the top of a plastic device back and forth (the device resembles a credit card imprint machine).  The first player to shout out a word of five letters or more that starts with the first letter and ends with the second wins the tiles.  Whoever wins the most tiles wins the game. A Tom Wham game appearing in Dragon (Issue 88 - Aug 1984). Move your hunter on the board and capture animals to bring back to port. Players hire hunters and collect supplies for an expedition to the interior. When they feel they are ready, they set out to hunt wild game and bring back lots of animals - alive. First one to 100 points wins.<br/><br/>

Although the game superficially resembles Monopoly, instead of becoming the richest player by bankrupting everyone else, the goal is to be the first player to raise enough money to fly "south", i.e. somewhere in Central or South America.<br/><br/>This is accomplished by carrying out the usual Mafia activities during the Prohibition Era: bootlegging, racketeering, narcotics smuggling, robbery, bookmaking and Al Capone's favorite.. income tax evasion. A game of light-hearted acquisition and conquest for 2-6 players. Each player represents a powerful wizard -- a Magus -- and attempts to acquire various Power Zones represented on the game board. By skillful use of his acquisitions and cards, each player then attempts to gain control of the Towers of all other players, or else gain all Power Zones on the game board.<br/><br/>Published in Dragon Magazine #147.  Artwork by Tom Wham.<br/><br/>

A book containing the following six cooperative games: Space Explorer, Resources, Rescue, Peace Conference, Search, and Round 'n' Round.<br/><br/>Part of a series of five paper-and-pencil game books by Sid Sackson, including Beyond Competition, Beyond Solitaire, Games of Art, Beyond Words, and Calculate!.<br/><br/>

Each player has eleven pieces on a 7X7 grid. There are two types of pieces (Sparks and Orbs), only one of which (Sparks) can capture or be captured. This expansion was designed by Terence Donnelly, and adds 30 new dungeon tiles and 30 new encounter cards. The players are also given five new types of characters to select from in building their parties.<br/><br/>Expands:<br/><br/>    The Sorcerer's Cave<br/><br/><br/>

In the Ancient World, civilizations are built upon 3 foundations: Commerce, Construction, and Expansion. The game is a Go-Moku elaboration; players must get five pieces in a row. Another game centered around the 'Raiders of the Lost Ark' movie.  Spin the spinner, move your piece, and do what the board says.  To win, collect the four cards of the same color.  The board looks good, but the mechanics are weak.<br/><br/>

from the box: "All the fun of lane bowling without the gutter balls" and "The bowling game you can play anywhere, anytime!"<br/><br/>Roll the dice, score the points as in bowling, pass the dice to the next player.<br/><br/>Comes with 10 dice and scoring pad.<br/><br/>Similar games:<br/><br/>    Spare Time Bowling<br/>    Bowl and Score<br/>    Bowl-A-Strike<br/><br/><br/>

Contains six competitive paper-and-pencil word games by Sid Sackson, each named after an author suggested by the style of the game: Tolstoy, Joyce, Dickens, Poe, Carroll, and O. Henry.<br/><br/>Part of a series of five paper-and-pencil game books by Sid Sackson, including Beyond Competition, Beyond Solitaire, Games of Art, Beyond Words, and Calculate!.<br/><br/>

Contains six paper-and-pencil games with various themes, meant to be played while assisted by eight-digit, "four-banger" calculators (still a relative novelty when the book was published). Contains six paper-and-pencil games meant to be played by a single player, including Four Color, Pinball, Profit & Loss, Mountains & Valleys, No Way, and Buried Treasure (which is not to be confused with the later Sackson game of the same title that is a re-theming of Das Super-Blatt).<br/><br/>Part of a series of five paper-and-pencil game books by Sid Sackson, including Beyond Competition, Beyond Solitaire, Games of Art, Beyond Words, and Calculate!.<br/><br/>

Dragonriders of Pern presents the struggle among the Leaders of the six different Weyrs to be recognized as leader of Pern.  Each player vies with the others for the support of the Lord Holders while simultaneously keeping Pern free of Thread.  If the northern continent of Pern has been so Threaded that it cannot support life, then all the players lose, along with Pern.<br/><br/>

The Battle for Orbit continues!  Technology runs amok as this expansion for Hard Vacuum finds the space war moving into 1945! From the Italian company International Team comes this fairly simple game of piracy on the high seas.<br/><br/>On a map that can only be considered a fantasy world you sail your galleon around the outer islands picking up treasure chests in the hope of delivering the treasures to his island in the middle of the board.<br/><br/>Movement is handled by way of a wind disk. Quad Checkers is an abstract strategy game where 4 players move small discs on an 8x8 board, attempting to "capture" an opponent's pieces. It is very similar to the basic Checkers game.<br/><br/>On each turn, players may only move in a diagonal direction. If a player's piece cannot move to a square, as an opponent's piece is occupying it, the piece is instead moved to the following diagonal square and the opponent's piece is removed from the board (captured). A game where the object is to build 3 cars on your assembly line. You start out with just the Chassis and must move along the assembly line to acquire the Wheel Base, Engine Block, Steering Posts, and Body to complete each vehicle. The first person to complete all 3 car assemblies is the winner. The car companies represented in the game are Plymouth, Studebaker, Chevy, and Ford.<br/><br/>

Welcome to the best FTF fantasy baseball board game ever created. This baseball game is for people who like meat and potatoes with a side of greens. It is the whole enchilada. Baseball Strategy is not meant for the shy, but the hearty. Great baseball action. Thrilling too! Never a dull moment and you will actually feel li...

"The Outlaws hunt the Sheriff. The Sheriff hunts the Outlaws. The Renegade plots secretly, ready to take one side or the other. Bullets fly. (From back of box)<br/><br/>The card game BANG! recreates an old-fashioned spaghetti western shoot-out, with each player randomly receiving a Character card to determine...

An amalgam of Scattergories and Spoons.  Players are given four cards, and must pass one and draw one until someone has a four-letter word that fits the category drawn at the beginning of the round.  When someone grabs a beanbag signaling he or she has a word, everyone grabs for one.    When someone is caught six times without a bag, the game ends, and whomever has the most points wins the game.<br/><br/>

The object of Bioscopy is to be the first player or team to score 20 points in each of the 4 categories of trivia (Who, What, When, and Where).<br/><br/>Each player or team puts their playing marker at the center of the board, and their 4 scoring markers on the 0 at the start of each of the 4 scoring scrolls. Players take turns rolling a six-sided die to determine how far you may move on the board, moving in any direction they choose (but they may not visit the same space twice in a turn). The s...

"The Complete-the-Lyric Game"<br/><br/>Two or three teams attempt to complete lyrics from popular songs. Players are given the year, the artist, the song title and the first two or three words; if nobody can get it, then more words are revealed.<br/><br/>

Royal Steeple Chase is a very astonishing game, published in 1939 by Miro Company in France.<br/>4 horses compete on a track of 21 spaces, with hedges and rivers. The players receive cards which indicate two actions. They use these to bid on the horse of their choice.  They can then buy better cards at auction. The money from the bids is shared equally between all the players, and then the race takes place. Each player in turn plays a card and carries out its two actions in the preferred order. The ho...

Tochtli is a strategy game in which you out-maneuver your opponent by moving, jumping, splitting, or stacking your game pieces to control one of six triangles.<br/><br/>Components:<br/><br/>     One game board consisting of 12 spaces forming 6 outer points (triangles).<br/>     Six pieces of each color (12 total)<br/><br/><br/>

The gameboard is a 7x9 grid. The players draw from a bag containing seventy-eight tiles called nuggets. Each nugget represents one of six metals. Each player, in turn, places one, two or three nuggets on the gameboard. The nuggets placed must match each other, however. The player then ends the turn by replacing the nuggets played with nuggets from the bag. Every subsequ...

Players are dealt a hand of card and attempt to form the highest scoring equation in each of the four rounds -- addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. For example, a player holding the cards 0, 0, 4, 4, 6, 6, 6, 8, 8, 9 could form this equation during the addition round and score 864:<br/><br/>800 + 64 = 864<br/><br/>Using every card is not mandatory. The game consists of two standard card decks including the jokers from each deck. A Run is four or more cards in the same suit in sequence. A Group is three or more of a kind. A Word is formed using the letters on the cards and can be any non-proper word found in a standard dictionary. A game consi...

Crypt: The Pharaoh's Curse is characterized as a "Trading Board Game", available in Starter Box Sets of 5 hexes (hexagonal tiles), 3 six-sided dice, 3 character cards, 34 action pieces (cards), and 20 life/creature tokens. From the introduction:<br/>"Snapshot" is a wargame of close-action combat between individuals.  It's primarily inside starships of the far future. The Succession Wars is a grand strategic game set in the BattleTech universe. A space battle game set in the Warhammer 40,000 universe.  BFG uses a variety of spaceship miniatures that are moved and fired by distance measuring. The core rules contain scenarios along with campaign rules.<br/><br/>The starter box was out of print for couple of years, but due to popular demand (or a large surplus of miniatures in their warehouse), Games Workshop re-...

Demonwand represents a struggle between powerful wizards for control of a magical land. The only human characters in the game are the Wizards themselves and the greatest warriors; ordinary mortals stay out of the way when dragons battle with demons and giants. The Wizards attempt to rally neutral beings to their cause, and to hamper their opponent's efforts by moving the very terrain itself. The landscape is enchanted, and its mountains and forests are subject to powerful spells. With these spells, the...

This is the first boardgame based on the Lost Worlds series of fighting gamebooks. Players would take miniatures into a 3-D plastic molded dungeon room, and maneuver on the board until they came into melee range, at which point they switched to the Lost Worlds books to resolve combat.<br/><br/>Rules were provided for movement, ranged combat and furniture. Based on the fantasy Lost Worlds game books (but incompatible with the Lost Worlds series). Each player uses a book and a stat sheet that represent their 'mech. A thematic series in the Lost Worlds series (these books are even compatible with the others). Players each take a character represented with a game book and a stat sheet. It takes money to make money. Each player will be putting up capital in anticipation of Profits. If you want the Big Bucks, though, you will have to form a Corporation with other players. A Corporation will net you Corporate Rewards if everyone cooperates -- but if any members defect (or if an outsider tries to horn in on the action) it's back to the drawing board.<br/><br/>

Hex-and-miniature game in which players fly spaceships filled with lemmings around the game area hoping to intentionally kill off their entire crew as quickly as possible. As your ship grows more powerful, you make a better target, but you'll do more damage to other players' ships.  The objective is to lose all 28 members of your crew.<br/>&lt...

An asymmetrical board game in which one player plays a nasty monster while the other player(s) take on the roles of family members defending their home from the evil intruder.  If the monster can kill the whole family, he wins.  If the family gets the monster first, they win.  The monster has certain advantages, special abilities, and is unidentified until he is seen by a family member, but family members can utilize items around the house (like moose-heads, ties, and remote-control cars) to attack the much...

The object of this game is to assume the identity of a famous American Colonist and collect bounty, money and signatures for the Declaration of Independence. This is done through a series of reenactments of historical events from the landing of the Pilgrims through the American Revolution<br/><br/>User review: Players start the game with an Identity Card. This tells the player who that person is during the game and what victory conditions must be met in order to win: the number of Signature Card...

Chaos Progenitus is a trading dice game for 2 or more players where you create a fiend, represented by 13 dice which fall into two categories: items and body parts. The fiends battle until one is defeated. Different combinations of dice and ink color represent different breeds of fiends, and each fiend must contain at least one body part. The object of the game is to be the last player that is able to roll at least one body part die at the beginning of his or her turn -- if you fail to do so, you lose the g...

This is an attempt to recreate the legendary battles of Van Helsing and the vampire hunters against Dracula, in Victorian London. The game is based on the books, not on the movies, so many things are different to what Vampire-fans are used to (Dracula CAN move during the day for example, although it tires him). The game takes two forms: a two player game and a simplified roleplaying game.  A game master is helpful, but optional.<br/><br/>

Game equipment consists of 72 letter tiles (color-coded to indicate vowel, common consonant, or less-common consonant) and two frames. Each frame holds 19 letter tiles in an array of four interlocking words, of 4, 5, 6 and 7 letters; the frames can be rotated and flipped to form 16 different patterns.  A player draws 19 to 25 tiles (depending on desired level of difficulty), balancing the colors to get a good mix of letters, and tries to form words in the frame.  Can be played solitaire or competitively.&lt...
A relative of Uno.  Players try to get rid of their cards by playing matching colors; special cards change the color or require players to swap hands or slap the discard pile.<br/><br/>

Fluxx meets Wyatt Earp.  Win by being the first to get three chips which match the three face-up "Wanted" posters.  But the cards played can not only let other players take your chips, they can require you to turn your chips over (displaying a different outlaw on the reverse) or can replace one Wanted poster with a new one.<br/><br/>

Bears little resemblance to the classic word game it's named for.  Each player starts with six letter tiles; the first to accumulate 19 or more is the winner.  Each player tries to form the longest possible word from the OTHER player's tiles, starting with the last tile drawn.  The first to find a word starts a marble rolling down a zigzag groove, and the other player must give a word before the marble reaches the bottom.  Then each player takes the tiles of the word they formed from the other pla...

Players are shown a picture of a "crime scene" and try to answer questions about it.  Since only twelve pictures come with the game, repeated playability is limited.<br/><br/>While there is only one listing for Crime Busters, it should be noted that three volumes were released, each with 12 mysteries to solve.<br/><br/>

A card displaying two or three letters is drawn, and players list as many words beginning with those letters as they can within the time limit.  Points are awarded for number of words, number of words not found by other players, and length of words.<br/><br/>
Rummy-like game in which players try to get rid of their cards by laying down "systems" consisting of U.S. cities and the (historic) railroads connecting them.<br/><br/>

Kid's game of pure luck.  Cards are dealt face down to all players.  Turn up cards in rotation and put them in the center; if you turn up a Big Fat Rat (rather than a Random Rat), you get all the cards in the center, unless the next player can also turn up a BFR.  Object is to collect all the cards.<br/><br/>This is one of the Big Deal series of games by Patch Products.<br/><br/>

(from box)  In Don't You Forget It, you're trying to be the first player to reach 500 points.  On each turn, roll the dice and try to score points...but here's the catch: At any time the special dice might spell out FORGET IT and cause you to lose any points you've earned for that round.  Roll the dice as many times as you wish, but you just might wish you stopped before the dice tell you to FORGET IT!<br/><br/>
Rummy-style word game.  Cards come in three different colors; each card has a letter and a point value.  Players try to spell words of at least three letters, all in the same color.<br/><br/>
Players advance around a track by guessing words with double meanings (A vagabond/To walk with heavy feet = tramp) or homonyms (Metal rooftop rooster/Mirror watcher = vane/vain).<br/><br/>

Players give crossword-style clues for words that can be placed on the board.  A four-player partnership game, with two- and three-player variants.<br/><br/>Knock-on-Word! is sort of a redesign of Joli Kansil's own Montage.<br/><br/>

Players take turn reading trivia questions from cards (example: Why do we tie shoes to the back of newlyweds' cars?), then either give the "correct" answer shown on the card or make up an answer.  Other players must guess which.<br/><br/>

Deep inside his crystal castle the mysterious King Laurin prevails since legendary times. His subjects are dwarves, who dig treasures from rock, in order to fill his vaults. In the wonderful garden of the king the dwarves show their lord the most precious treasures to rise in his favor. But only few will succeed in acquiring liberty ....<br/><br/>

Management Material is a card game with a corporate theme where the players try to win by avoiding being promoted to management. Players answer multiple-choice trivia questions of increasing difficulty, with the option of quitting with their winnings up to that point. Players rotate as host, and after everyone has taken a turn as host, winnings are totaled.<br/><br/>Based on the original ABC version of the world-famous game show, hosted by Regis Philbin from 1999-2002.<...

Rummy game with a 75-card deck, consisting of: the 52 standard cards; 13 "quadrate" cards bearing a rank and all four suits, with the effective suit determined by the roll of a special die; and ten wild cards.<br/><br/>

From the game box<br/>My Word! is a fascinating battle of wits for two people<br/><br/>How My Word! is played<br/>You attempt to discover your opponent's Gamewords by using Guesswords with letters that not only appear in the Gameword, but that also fall in matching position. Game for 2 to 4 players which combines strategy with a setting of medieval war and intrigue among the Scottish clans.<br/><br/>You are a Clan Chief trying for the regency of Scotland. A variant version of Sackson's Can't Stop. It uses cards, chips, and a scoresheet instead of a board and markers to keep score.<br/><br/>It comes in a small hard plastic case, similar to Pass the Pigs.<br/><br/>

A game for 2-4, where players place tiles of clear plastic with dots on them on a playing board with nine positions. Each turn the player can place a tile in a clear position, or over the stacked tiles in an filled position provided that the dots on the tile do not overlap those on the tiles already played. Once all 9 possible dots are placed in each position the stacked tiles are removed for reuse and the position is cleared for new tile placements. "183 grim-faced Texans volunteer for certain death to delay and decimate a besieging force of 2,000 highly trained Mexican regular infantry under the command of the ferocious Santa Anna." A fun fast paced game. What could be better, Travis, Crockett, Bowie and their fellow Texans vs. a horde of Mexicans. As the Texans you know you are going to be wiped out, the question is how many Mexicans can you take with you?<br/><br/>

The "1812 Grand Tactical game" is a simulation of the French invasion of Russia. The Grand Tactical game simulates the mechanics of strategic maneuver and tactical decision in this campaign. 2nd Fleet is a refinement of Victory Games (I) popular Sixth Fleet: Modern Naval Combat in the Mediterranean game system, and examines the strengths and weaknesses of the Soviet Red Banner Northern Fleet and the US Second Fleet and its NATO allies in future conflict for control of the North Atlantic and Arctic Oceans. Adeptus Titanicus was the first game introducing the Epic system. You control a number of Imperial Battle Titans, while your opponent controls some Chaos Titans. Stealing is legal in wordXchange, the all-new anagram game that pits you against your rivals and against the clock in an all-out battle to make and keep words.
