"In this fast-playing strategy game, shuttle your pieces around the maze-like gameboard and slide them out of the Exit Chutes by a mere tilting of the gameboard.  A toss of the die determines just how many tilts you make, but you, alone, must decide which gameboard side to tilt...and that takes a lot of plotting and planning."  The object is the be the first player to get all 6 of your playing pieces pattern-side-up on the gameboard or exit the single, black playing piece.<br/><br/>
A motorized "Disc-Dealer" releases 40 shaped discs two at a time which players attempt to match up to the 9 shapes in their board quadrant.  The first player to match all 9 shapes wins.<br/><br/>

The Munchkins are back – but now they're Mutants, Androids, and Cat People in space, grabbing Lasers, Vibroswords, and Nova Grenades and fighting Fanged Fuzzballs, Bionic Bimbos, and the Brain In A Jar. "Put on your hard hat and get ready to build.  Anything can happen when playing the exciting card game Raise the Roof. A Keythedral is being built in the fields near Keytown, in the middle of the Keydom. This expansion contains everything you need to include two additional players in The Starfarers of Catan, the exciting, fast moving, science fiction game.  Here you'll find 2 mother ships, 2 sets of playing pieces, additional cards, 2 reusable gameboard overlays, and a new alien race ripe for encounter.<br/><br/>Now you can play one of five or six Starfarers commissioned to explore the galaxy, build new colonies, and expand commercial ties with the various races of the Galactic Council. Now up to six players can muster their knights against the scourge threatening Catan! Now five to six players can sail into the uncharted and explore and settle the mysterious islands near Catan! Players each try to be the first to build a complete snake, connecting the head and tail of the snake printed on their large start tiles. How many tiles he plays and to which snake he plays the tiles depends on the roll of the special die.  The body tiles can contain turns, crossovers, and twists which can extend the distance your neig...

The Wheel of Time CCG is based on the novels of the same name, penned by Robert Jordan, and later, Brandon Sanderson. Modern Times takes place in the USA during the Roaring Twenties. Business is booming and industrial magnates are in a worldwide arms race. The board consists of motorized trees with rotating tops. By using your levers, you can raise and lower the treetops, catching your animals and moving them across the jungle and onto the beach.<br/><br/>However, you and your opponents can also use the treetops to knock animals off, sending them back to the start.<br/><br/>The first player to get five animals to the beach wins.<br/><br/>

Not a stats based game and not a "replay" game. Teams are fictional and can be built based on fixed points or amount of money the team has. Players are of three average, good, exceptional and cost different amounts of money to "hire". <br/>Money can either be a fixed amount in pick up games, or using the advanced economy rules, can be obtained from running concessions and selling broadcasting rights.<br/><br/>The dual-fold, multi-color game board folds for easy storage....

In the ever-evolving and chaotic world of the X-Men Trading Card Game, one thing is certain: You control the action. Hex was invented by the Danish mathematician and poet Piet Hein, who introduced the game in 1942 at the Niels Bohr Institute. The same year Hex appeared in the Danish newspaper Politiken under the name Polygon. Hein introduced the game to the readers on December 26, 1942 and during the following four months gave them a problem each day to begin with - eventually two days a week, on Wednesdays and Saturdays. The solution would always appear in the following column. It was independently invented by mathematic...

Tigers in the Mist, Ardennes Offensive, The Battle of the Bulge, December 16 - 22, 1944, this game simulates the early stages of the German offensive in the Ardennes section of Western Europe (Germany, France, Belgium, and Luxembourg) in December of 1944. Historically, the Germans planned to break through the thin American defenses in this area, cross the Meuse River, and seize the port of Antwerp in Belgium. The German high command hoped that success would force a political settlement on the Western Front,...

The play consists of forming interlocking words, crossword fashion on a board, using letter tiles. In each of five rounds players compete for high score by forming words on a crossword puzzle pattern on individual game boards, taking advantage of letter usage points and bonus words.<br/><br/>In rounds after the first, the board is passed to other players, so that each one is building on the partial crosswords of another player's previous rounds.<br/><br/>

The game consists of a playing board layout of a typical 18-hole championship golf course. A tee marker is moved along the course to indicate the number of strokes (rolls of the dice) a player has taken to "hole out." Twenty-five chips are given to each player at the start of the game, and these are given up as a player fails to keep their ball on track, eventually being won by whoever has the low score for the game. Also included are 3 dice and a pad of golf scorecards. The score is kept for each...

53 Cards represent the 50 States, Washington DC and the states of Confusion and Ecstasy.<br/><br/>The object is to go out by laying down sets of 3 cards, where all the cards are adjacent states. The first person to rid their hand of all cards ends the round and points are scored. Play is to 500.<br/><br/>

Don't Get Mad, Get Even!<br/><br/>After all, you're on your own and out for yourself in this rough-and-tumble, wild and woolly game.<br/><br/>It's dog-eat-dog every step of the way.<br/><br/>Even on EASY STREET you'll have to stay on your toes. You and your opponent alternately slip chips into the slotted gameboard. Whoever is the first person to get 5 of their color in a diagonal, vertical or horizontal row wins the game. But be careful, Slide 5 can be your downfall, for the gameboard is very changeable... if a row is filled with 5 chips (not all of the same color), a player may insert another chip into that row causing the others to slide down into new positions and to force out the bottom chip. So look every which way before you Slide 5!<br/...

A fast paced poker dice Yahtzee variant. All players build their point scores from common rolls of the dice, but use their own judgment for possible combinations and scoring. It's a natural for game players who love to win by out-thinking their opponents.<br/><br/>Includes 25 dice (5 red; 20 white), dice cup, scorepad, game tray, and instructions.<br/><br/>

The family card game with a ROYAL TWIST!<br/><br/>This game plays similarly to UNO, but with more complex "wild" cards. The Magic Potion  dissolves all your "scroll card" points when someone else goes out (scroll cards are cards with special abilities who's values range from 20 to 50)....

This is a simulation of the post-Normandy campaigns from September 1st, 1944 to April 1945 on the West front. The game covers the initial attempts by the Allies to maintain the pace of their advance in the face of a rapidly deteriorating logistical situation, the German recovery culminating in the Battle of the Bulge, and the final Allied drive across the Rhine.<br/><br/>Scale is "grand operational" with division and brigade/regiment-size ground units and air wings. The same game as "classic" Battleship, but instead of your opponent telling you whether you have hit or missed, you enter the coordinates for your shot into the computer and it either flashes a red light and makes an explosion sound if you hit or a whistling sound if you missed.<br/><br/>Later versions added a "code book" with 100+ different ship layouts to speed up the initial setup of the game (in the original version you had to program in the coordinates for all of your sh...

Players move around the board conducting various games of chance (horse racing, lottery, lucky number, etc.) in order to win money.  The first person to reach a certain money level wins the game.  The centerpiece of the game is a unique dice shaker that randomizes the dice and has them fall into the handle so that players can bet on the order that the dice fall in (where the highest die will be located, for example).<br/><br/>

Austro-Prussian War is the third of the Wars of the Imperial Age series. The concept of Arne is new. Arne is cheeky, creative, and chaotic. And always spiced with the most unexpected turns. Players / Teams try to identify what is shown in the black and white pictures that are revealed one section at a time.<br/><br/>

Players play a game of checkers with letter cubes. "Connect Four" with a twist: the balls are kept hidden from both players, so they must try to remember which colored balls are where.  When a player thinks they have four in a row, they pull the lever that drops the balls into sight.  If they are right, they score a point.  If they are wrong, their opponent scores a point.  The first player to eight points wins.<br/><br/>

Fire in Mississippi recreates the Civil War Battle of Corinth, October 3-4, 1862 when Confederate Generals Earl Van Dorn and Sterling Price hoped to seize the vital transportation center of Corinth, Mississippi.<br/><br/>

You spin an arrow and get to pick fence pieces which you use to enclose pig pens. If you enclose all your 4 pigs , you win.  Ages 5 and up................fun game to play with your children.<br/><br/>

A fascinating game of chance and risk, Biras consists of 6 coloured cubes, a board, and requires between two or more players (aged 7 upwards). Microbadge:  <br/><br/>Spellfire is a CCG put out by TSR, using many of the monsters and personalities from the various Dungeons and Dragons settings (Forgotten Realms, Dark Sun, Ravenloft, Dragonlance, etc).  The first player to play 6 realm cards and successfully protect them wins the game. Holiday USA challenges players ages 8 - adult to follow a calendar board and be the player to have the most points at the end of the year (game) Players collect red, white and blue point chips as they correctly answer one of 1100 trivia questions covering the history and traditions of American holidays and observances. Hougomont is a tactical level simulation of the fight for Hougomont chateau during the battle of Waterloo.<br/><br/>Game scale : each hex is 25 yards, each turn 10 mins of real time, each unit is a company. "Fulda Gap: The First Battle of the Next War", is a regimental/brigade level wargame simulation of a possible Warsaw Pact assault into West Germany through the area of relatively open terrain centered around the town of Fulda sometime in the near future. Dreadnought: Surface Combat in the Battleship Era, 1906-45, is a two-player simulation of surface naval warfare in the period 1906 to 1944 with the primary emphasis on the role of the all big-gun battleship (Dreadnought) in fleet actions. The object is to remain in business longer than any other driver. This is done by bidding on and delivering loads and making enough money to cover all expenses (fuel cost and truck rent).<br/><br/>

KOREA is a division level game of the police action during 1950 and 51.<br/><br/>3 scenarios: <br/>1) The 17 turn Invasion Scenario (North Korea invades the South)<br/>2) The 9 turn Intervention Scenario (Chinese forces attack overextended U.N. units occupying North Korea)<br/>3) The 21 turn Stalemate Scenario (U.N. forces gradually grind the Communists back toward the 38th parallel)<br/><br/>255 Counters<br/><br/>

"Foxbat & Phantom" is a wargame simulation of tactical aerial combat in the 1970's. The game is basically a two player game but it can be modified to accommodate any number of players. Man of War is a tactical study of the height of the Age of Sail. The game uses 4 minute turns and 250 yard hexes. The premise of this two-player SF wargame is that the US and USSR have established competing well-armed mining operations in the asteroid belt when a period of massive solar flares makes manned space travel inside the orbit of Mars impossible. SF wargame in which a human colony ship and a robotic "DESTRUCTOR" cruiser have disabled one another in a firefight, and the player has 14 turns to infiltrate the cruiser with a crew of human soldiers and destroy either its Command Computer or all Repair robots. The players compete for control of the eight Citadels on the fantasy world of Arklyrell. The winner is the player with control of the most Citadel hexes after 25 turns. Dinosaurs reside on the modular hexagons of the super-continent Pangaea. Each hex can only support a certain number of animals. Players try to disperse as widely as is wise while still dominating each continent where they exist. A creative placing-game in which the nooks, boomerang-shaped cards with different colors, have to be arranged. Players collect point for connecting the nooks to others with as many sides as possible.<br/><br/>

Globopolis is a turn and point board game with a futuristic Sci Fi theme, that incorporates strategic elements of resource acquisition and trading, the acquisition and building of territories, along with aggression scenarios.<br/><br/>

A game of flicking mice around a race track, while avoiding falling in the holes. Massive board shows Ulysses' voyage from Troy to Ithaca.<br/><br/>Players take on the roles of Minerva (helping him) or Neptune (hampering him). The latter secretes 8 perils about the Mediterranean. Players create their own characters and fight it out! Detailed rules for on ships and weapons are included. Ulysses & Co. set sail for Ithaca. What should be a short journey turns out to be an incredible adventure based on Homer's epic poem, The Odyssey. Commercially-published variant of Chess. The major change is that pieces, apart from the king, can be attached to other pieces of the same player. The highest piece is called the Trojan figure and it is the one whose movement mode controls the movement of the conglomerate. Once attached, pieces may later be detached. As you might expect, there are also some special rules around pawn promotion, e.g. only queen per side is permitted.<br/><br/>

One player takes on the role of Odysseus, trying to get safely to Ithaka. The other plays Poseidon, attempting to prevent same. Odysseus moves according to the spinner with distance determined by color results on dice. Various spaces generate event cards. Poseidon moves via cloud and if he can catch a ship there is an attack on that ship.<br/><br/>Rated for Ages 10 and up.<br/><br/>

Basically a cross between "Blackjack" and a competitive version of "Bingo." 2 player game depicting the hunt for Merchant raiders at the start of World War I. The map shows the whole world. Be the first player to collect ten horses of one breed and you win. You can collect Thoroughbreds, Arabians, Clydesdales, Tennessee Walkers, and Quarter Horses. Racing game, which can be played as a simple "roll-the-dice-and-move" game for younger players or as a strategy game where each player has a identical set of cards of Fuel points. Not to be confused with divinatory tarot, the game of tarot probably comes from Italy. Created to commemorate the famous 1927 first solo flight over the Atlantic. Card game similar to Touring was published in a form fitting box with 75 cards:  39 mileage, 10 take off, 10 weather, 15 hazards and 1 Lucky Lindy. Players use over-sized cards to "join" partners' body parts- elbows, heads, legs, or feet.  Partners take turns drawing cards which identify the body parts to join and the partners must do so without causing existing cards to drop.  The card must be kept between the two body parts at all times. Partners are eliminated if they allow 2 cards to fall.<br/><br/>

Johnny Reb III is a game of Grand Regimental tactics of the American Civil War, using miniatures from 10mm to 25mm.The game comes with rules set and 4 Reference cards for 15mm miniatures. Play 9 holes of golf on a simulated course using dice.  On the board each hole is divided into regions which require you to use a certain club.  The roll of the dice cross-referenced with the club determines where your ball goes next.<br/><br/>

A odd filler-type game with lots of little colored dice.  Each player tries to harvest fruit, and the interesting mechanism is that some of the dice you roll are given to others other players, and this can help you. Of all the Fanfor games, this is one of the more approachable ones.<br/><br/>

A simple card-based memory game. 21 cards showing two hand images in various colors are spread out on the table. On his turn, a player rolls a die and covers a hand image of the matching color. If he covers the last uncovered image on a card, he must announce the color of the other, previously covered, image. If he's correct, he gets the card as a point. If not, his turn ends and the next player takes his turn. Play continues until only 5 cards are left. Most cards won wins the game.<br/><br/&...

Self-titled as the "brilliant but vicious" new game. Each player races to move two pawns to their spaces at the end of the board. A Starka can move one space diagonally but can jump in any direction. A Schnook can move one space forward, left or right.<br/><b...

Abstract war/strategy game. Each player has one row of pieces deployed at one side of an 8x9 grid. An elastic band divides the board. Pieces move vertically and horizontally with the objective of placing one piece in the opponents back row. The gimmick is pieces can be eliminated by stretching the elastic band (the boundary) around an opponents piece(s) which eliminates that piece and causes the boundary to change (as that piece is removed from play).<br/><br/>

Ragnarok: The Twilight of the Gods is a game depicting the struggle of the Aesir race of Norse gods against an invasion of enemies led by the traitorous god, Loki. Run Hippy! Run!The Boardgame is the game of capitalism let loose on the globe. Award-winning cooperative boardgame that was published more than a decade before Knizia's The Lord of the Rings, Sauerbaum is a dice-based movement game. The board depicts a tree filled with a square grid of movement spaces, which are gradually filled from the top with tokens representing acid rain. A version of the traditional game "Yacht" (an English version of Generala).<br/><br/>This game has several rule and scoring differences from Yahtzee, which was based on "Yacht".<br/><br/>
A meticulously hand-produced bike racing game with great but delicate components.  Beyond that, can't say much because I don't have a rules translation though I'm working on it.<br/><br/>

Players are rock stars and collect gold records to win. Roll dice to spiral in the player counters from the start to end square on the board. Squares have events for players to collect or lose money or release an album, which may turn out to be a hit, a dud, or break-even. Game comes with a 45 RPM record which must be played when any album is released. A random track determines the success of the album.<br/><br/>

Each turn in the children's game Maskenball der Käfer, each player spins the spinner on the board. If the spinner points to one of the eight ladybugs, the player may move that ladybug to visit the others. Each ladybug piece has a magnet in its nose, and if the visiting ladybug "likes" the ladybug (i.e., is attracted to it), they may swap spots (each ladybug has five spots of one color), and she continues on to visit other ladybugs; if the ladybugs do not like each other, the turn is over...

LOSER is a party game where players move around the board based on their responses to questions about bad behavior, bad judgment, and just plain bad luck.  The colors on the board and the roll of the dice add an element of "Loser's Luck" to the game.  A social game with lots of embarrassing storytelling.  Because we've all done things we're not proud of.<br/><br/>

One of the Fanfor "Big Box" games (along with Brauerei, Geweihte Steine, Neues Land, and ITC), this one dealing with environmental issues. Each player has two roles to play - one must protect the environment while the other must fell the trees for profit.  This general idea was used later (and a bit better) in Visjes by Cwali (also called Ocean). Multiple scoring options and generally good ideas but marginal game play.<br/><br/>

Articulation is a word game that can be played either individually or in teams.<br/><br/>The five categories in the game are slang, jargon, word origins, spelling, and vocabulary. The north pole animals hold their own athletic contests.<br/><br/>Intended for children Ages 5 and up.<br/><br/>

A trivia game where gameplay is extremely similar to 'Trivial Pursuit'. Main difference is all questions deal with quotes made by famous people. All questions are multiple choice, and players must 'fill in the blank' from a quote read from the question card.<br/><br/>

In the land of ancient Greece, called Hellas, the people waged power struggles for control of the many valuable islands. The combatants faced each other over land and across the seas. In this game, the players try to earn wooden sticks by advancing colored beavers on spaces of matching color. The board is set on balance on a wooden piece. When moving a beaver, you have to carefully choose the right one, so as to not let the board fall.<br/><br/>

Thud! is an abstract game based on Terry Pratchett's DISCWORLD saga, more specifically on the epic Battle of Koom Valley between the Dwarfs and the Trolls. A fast-paced martial arts game for 2 players. Takes 10 minutes to learn & play for hours of enjoyment. In each game you can win, lose or draw. A match is won when one of the players wins 2 games.<br/><br/>

In Rays of Light, each player sets up colored chips and chips representing mirrors on their grid, which is hidden from their opponent, much like in Battleship. Using this information, you try to recreate your opponent's grid before he does the same.<br/><br/>Rays of Light could be described...

The White Flame is a scenario pack for the Star Trek Starship Combat Game which details the exploits of the Emperor's own 123rd Assault Flotilla. Baston is a humorous skirmish fighting board-wargame which takes place in a suburban French bar. There are 360 cards divided into 4 categories: Places, People, Nature and Objects with 10 clues each and a word that corresponds to the clues. Each category has their own color. Based on the NBC TV show.<br/><br/>Players secretly write an answer to a "loaded" question in their Secret Answer Cover. The Master of Ceremonies then reads these answers aloud.<br/><br/>The object is to score points by guessing correctly who wrote each answer.<br/><br/>
Be the first player to move Indiana Jones, Short Round, and Willie Scot past the many dangers and hazards and finally across the rope bridge to safety.<br/><br/>

Players roll their 13 letter cubes and then arrange them into words crossword style before the timer runs out.  Once time is up, players score their words.
